observationText: The Nf1aL1247X zebrafish line was generated by TILLING (targeting induced local lesions in genomes) to introduce a nonsense mutation in the nf1a gene, resulting in a premature stop codon.
Zebrafish homozygous for the Nf1aL1247X mutation in nf1a and lacking functional nf1b exhibited early larval lethality between 7 and 10 days post fertilization.
The Nf1aL1247X zebrafish mutants exhibited significant defects in the central and peripheral nervous systems.
Nf1aL1247X zebrafish mutants exhibited hyperplasia and aberrant differentiation of oligodendrocyte progenitor cells and Schwann cells in the nervous system.
The Nf1aL1247X zebrafish mutants showed irregularities in the myelin sheaths surrounding neuronal axons in the central nervous system.
The Nf1aL1247X zebrafish mutants exhibited upregulation of phosphorylated ERK1/2 (pERK1/2) levels, indicating hyperactivation of the Ras signaling pathway.
